results.name: Array T(n,k) (n>=1, k>=1) read by antidiagonals: T(n,n) = 1 for all n; fill in array above diagonal by symmetry; for row n, starting at diagonal T(n,n)=1, for k > n, T(n,k) = T(n,k-1)-(k-1) if this is positive and has not already appeared in this row, otherwise T(n,k) = T(n,k-1)+(k-1).
link: Index entries for sequences related to Recamán's sequence
mathematica: T[n_, n_] = 1; T[n_, k_] /; k < n := T[n, k] = T[k, n]; T[n_, k_] := T[n, k] = If[t = T[n, k - 1] - (k - 1); t > 0 && FreeQ[Table[T[n, j], {j, 1, k - 1}], t], t, T[n, k - 1] + (k - 1)]; Table[T[n - k + 1, k], {n, 1, 13}, {k, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 18 2018 *)
xref: Rows give A063733, A066203, A066204. Cf. A066201 for another version.
